intro: Gymnosiphon squamatus, commonly known as the squamated gymnosiphon, is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its slender, branched stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink to purple in color, which bloom during the warmer months. Its unique botanical features include the presence of glandular hairs on the stems and leaves, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Gymnosiphon squamatus is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
